pr_title: Add thrift serde support for TaskStatus

timeline.message: Add thrift support for TaskStatus serde
Add thrift serde support for TaskStatus

timeline.bodyText: Had to make this a public constructor since drift did not have support for factory methods like Jackson (We can add in something if there are more use cases that require this). At present drift only supports constructors and Builder method . Let me know if there is a better way.
timeline.author: ajaygeorge
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -73,7 +77,8 @@
      */
     private final int port;
 
-    private HostAddress(String host, int port)
+    @ThriftConstructor
+    public HostAddress(String host, int port)

timeline.message:
Add thrift serde support for TaskStatus

Added Drift annotations to TaskStatus and related classes
to support thrift serde.

timeline.bodyText: isRecursive = TRUE -- Cool!  Did not know of this trick.
timeline.author: tdcmeehan

timeline.bodyText: While we're doing this exercise, it would be nice not have to do String parsing for these values.  Did you consider an alternate constructor, perhaps that takes in a boolean with OptionalInt, and validates that when it's not grouped it's empty, and when it's grouped it's not empty?
timeline.author: tdcmeehan

replies.bodyText:
This logic was sort of mimicking what the json factory method was doing.
public static Lifespan jsonCreator(String value)
replies.author: ajaygeorge

replies.bodyText: I wonder if we can use jsonCreator(String value) here.  We can rename the method. createLifeSpan?
replies.author: cemcayiroglu

replies.bodyText: @cemcayiroglu  don't think a constructor can refer to a factory method directly. The alternate is going the builder route which in drift requires a complete Builder class. We can try adding in support for factory methods similar to what Jackson does as a good enhancement later on.
replies.author: ajaygeorge

timeline.bodyText: I would add a comment saying that the order needs to be backwards compatible, because in theory the TaskState could be persisted.
timeline.author: tdcmeehan

timeline.bodyText: Similar here--please comment saying that the ordinal needs to be backwards compatible.
timeline.author: tdcmeehan

replies.bodyText:
I was wondering if it would make sense to do a refactoring to add a integer code as a constructor
something like  USER_ERROR(0) , INTERNAL_ERROR(1) and so on.
replies.author: ajaygeorge
